title: What is DISGAEA?
body:
DISGAEA RPG 
The most challenging and fiercest RPG ever, depicting the exploits of various demons, Overlords, angels and humans, all taking place in a place called the "Netherworld".

In this game, players can immerse themselves in the entire DISGAEA series, a world where the 
values of good and evil are reversed, face a range of exciting challenges, and enjoy an entirely new story
starring many classic DISGAEA characters.

Special Thanks
We sincerely thank DJ Moore for his work as Localization Editor and general DISGAEA Expert.

title: Basics
body:
Immerse yourself in the world of DISGAEA, and become kingmaker to the next top Overlord!
A range of unique characters from previous games in the DISGAEA series will join you in your quest as you train up your candidate for the role of strongest Overlord.
There are two types of characters for you to choose from, Humanoid and Monster. 
You can recruit both types via summoning, then put them in your battle party to start training them.

title: Stats
body:
Each character has the
following 6 base stats.

HP… Character's hit points.
When a character takes damage in battle
and their HP is reduced to 0, they will become unable to battle.

ATK… Character's attack.
Characters with a higher ATK deal more damage
with basic attacks and ATK-based skills.

DEF… Character's defense.
Characters with a higher DEF take less damage
from ATK-based attacks.

INT… Character's intelligence, or magic attack.
Characters with a higher INT deal more damage
with INT-based skills.

RES… Character's resistance to magic attacks.
Characters with a higher RES take less damage
from INT-based attacks.

SPD… Character's speed.
mCharacters with a higher SPD
can act more frequently.

CRT… Character's chance
to land critical hits.
Characters with a higher CRT
have a better chance to land critical hits.

CRD… Character's damage dealt
from critical hits.
Characters with a higher CRD
deal more damage with critical hits.

title: About Base Stats
body:
Base stats increase as
the character levels up.
Base stats include the following 5 stats.

, HP
, ATK
, DEF
, INT
, RES

title: ★ Number
body:
★ Number indicates the basic strength of a character.
Any character can reach as high as 6★ via awakening.
And depending on the number of ★, the character's class name will be changed accordingly.

title: Level
body:
Characters stats will increase as they level up.
Characters get new Unique Skills upon reaching certain levels.

title: Max Level
body:
There is a cap on each character's level.
Initially, Max Level is Lv100.
You can "Reincarnate" a character who has reached their Max Level. 
Each Reincarnation adds 100 to that character's Level Cap.

title: Weapon Mastery
body:
Weapon Mastery indicates which types of weapon a character is better at using.
 
Weapon Mastery has its own Current Level and Max Level.

The Max Level of Weapon Mastery can be increased with Mana, which is obtained by Reincarnating characters. 
The Current Level can be increased by using that corresponding type of weapon in battle, or by consuming certain items.

A higher Current WM Level means weapons of that type are more powerful when equipped by a character and used in battle.

Characters get new Weapon Skills upon reaching certain Weapon Mastery Levels.

title: Skills
body:
Each character may
configure up to 4 skills.
Your characters can use
configured skills in battles.
When a character has their weapon changed,
current weapon skills will become unavailable.
Therefore, after you change a character's weapon, please don't forget to remove the configured weapon skills.
For skills that cost HP,
if a character uses such a skill at 1 HP,
their HP will become 0 after the attack.

title: Skill Types
body:
There are 3 types of special Skills: 
Unique Skills, Weapon Skills and Spells, which are learned in different ways.
 
 ① Unique Skills 
Learned upon reaching certain Character Levels or after reaching certain Nether Enhancement stages.
 
 ② Weapon Skills 
Learned upon reaching certain Current Weapon Mastery Levels for that corresponding weapon.
 (Staff, Monster Physical and Monster Magic excluded). 
Weapon Skills are only usable 
when the corresponding weapon is equipped.
 
 ③ Spells 
Learned upon certain Current Weapon Mastery Levels 
(only Staff and Monster Magic).

Different Spells are available 
to different characters.

title: Skill Level
body:
Skills have their own levels. 
EXP for Skills is obtained by winning battles with the corresponding moves set or by consuming certain items.
 
Skills with higher levels cost less SP and are more effective.

title: Evility
body:
Evilities have various
effects in battle.

There are two types of Evilities:
Main Evilities
that are inherent to each character,
and Sub Evilities
that can be learned from
Nether Enhancement.

In a battle, all participants and
entourages' Evilities
take effect.

In the squad, if there are multiple Evilities
that determine that basic attack damage is based on a certain stat,
the character placed furthest to the right in the Party's skill takes precedence.



※ When a character has an Evility that protects other characters,
if the character's HP will drop to 0 after the protecting an attack,
their Evility will not be triggered.
※ Even when a character's Evility is sealed,
the EXP, HL, and chest drop rate bonuses from the Evility
will still work normally.
※ When an Evility requires a certain buff effect,
it will only be triggered
when the character has that buff.

title: Cheat Rank
body:
Cheat Rank increases the basic stats of a character.
It's applicable for each stat respectively. 
You get Mana by Reincarnating in Mao's Lab, then apply it in "Ability Cheat" to increase your Cheat Rank.

title: Mana
body:
You get Mana by Reincarnating Characters.
In Mao's Lab, the Mana you get can be allocated via "Allocate Mana" to grant a character "Ability Cheats" (to increase certain Stats) or increase their WM Level Cap. 
You can spend Mana however you like 
to make your characters stronger.

title: Resistance
body:
Resistance reduces damage taken by the 4 elements of each skill in battle.
0 is the baseline. 
A positive number means the character is resistant to an element. 
The higher the number, the less damage taken from an element.
A negative number means the character is vulnerable to an element. 
The lower the number, the more damage taken from an element.

title: Weapon Forte
body: Each Character has one Weapon Forte, which means a higher starting WM Level Cap for this type of weapon than for the others.

title: About Potential Type
body:
Potential Type
is also a character stat.

Each character belongs to
one of the six potential types:
King, Pawn, Rook, Knight, Bishop, and Queen.

When a character levels up, they gain bonus effects based on their potential type.

title: Basics
body:
Just like characters, equipment also has stats that can be raised and then added to a character while it's equipped.

There are 2 types of equipment: Weapons and Armor. 
Aside from purchasing items from the Shop, they can also be obtained in the Item World or earned as various kinds of rewards.

There are a few factors that affect the strength of equipment: 
Level, Rarity, Rank and Innocents.

You can check the rank of a piece of equipment upon purchase or via the Item World. 
The higher the rank, the better the equipment.

title: Equipment Rarity
body:
Each piece of equipment has a rarity, graded 0 to 100.
Equipment of a higher rarity provides better stats,
contains more Innocents, and has a higher POP.

In addition, all equipment is
categorized into the following three tiers, based on rarity.

<COMMON>
Rarity 0-39

<RARE>
Rarity 40-69

<LEGENDARY>
Rarity 70-100

title: Equipment Level
body:
All equipment has a level.
Equipment of a higher levels
have better stats. Progress through the Item World
to increase equipment levels.

A piece of equipment's level cap
is determined by its tier.

<COMMON>
Max Level 0-39

<RARE>
Max Level 40-69

<LEGENDARY>
Max Level 180

title: About Exclusive Weapons
body:
Some weapons can only
be equipped by certain characters.
Exclusive weapons have
unique, powerful effects.

Exclusive weapons can be
upgraded in the Item World, just like ordinary ones.

title: Innocents
body:
Innocents are creatures that dwell inside equipment.
Innocents have the effects corresponding to their names."Subdue" Innocents in the Item World
to make them take effect.

< HP Boost, ATK Boost, INT Boost,
DEF Boost, RES Boost, SPD Boost,
HP Amplifier, ATK Amplifier, DEF Amplifier,
INT Amplifier, RES Amplifier>
→ Determines the equipment stats affected.

< EXP Boost, HL Boost, WM Enhancer
Skill Enhancer>
→ Provide bonus effects to the user
in battles.

In addition, some special Innocents
can only be obtained from events.

title: About Unique Innocents
body:
Unique Innocents
have
unique effects.

Unique Innocents
cannot be obtained
by purchasing equipment in the shop.
Unique Innocents can be obtained
from events and other channels.

title: Innocent Rarity
body:
There are 3 Rarities for Innocents. 
COMMON < RARE < LEGEND 
The rarer the Innocent is, the better it will be.

title: POP (Max Innocent Number)
body:
Equipment also have another stat known as "POP",
which refers to the
max number of Innocents that can be stored.
The number of current Innocents
and max Innocent capacity is displayed as POP.
>
For example:>
POP 6 / 10
(Current Innocents/Max Innocents)

title: Innocent Transfer
body:
Innocents subdued in the Item World can be removed and applied in "Innocent Transfer".
It's free to remove an Innocent for the first time, but it costs HL to do so again in the future.
The higher the Rarity of the Innocent, the higher the cost to remove them.

title: Basics
body:
It's turn-based manual combat with a team of up to 5 members.
You win the battle by defeating all enemy waves, and lose the battle if 
all your members are defeated.

Combatants, friendly or enemy alike, act one by one according to the order shown in the 
Action Gauge.

title: SP
body:
SP are the points required for characters to use their Skills in battle.
The SP cost differs for each Skill.

title: Skills
body:
Each character may
configure up to 4 skills.
Using skills costs SP.

Each skill has unique effects.
Some deal damage; some restore HP;
some inflict the following 4 ailing statuses.

< Poison>
Whenever a poisoned character takes action,
they take damage equal to 10% of their max HP.
A poisoned character will eventually have their HP reduced to 1,
but poison effects will not reduce their HP to 0.

< Sleep>
Sleeping characters cannot take any action for a certain number of turns.
A sleeping character will be awakened when attacked.
Paralyzed characters will do nothing during their turn.

< Paralysis>
Paralyzed characters cannot take any action for a certain number of turns.
Paralyzed characters will do nothing during their turn.

< Paralysis>
Paralyzed characters cannot take any action for a certain number of turns.

title: Killing EXP
body: Delivering the killing blow grants a Kill Bonus, which provides more EXP than usual.

title: Lifting
body:
Your characters can lift other characters
to launch a tower attack.
Characters carrying other characters
cannot use skills.
They can only perform "throw"
or "tower attack".
The more characters lifted, the stronger they become,
the more damage the tower attack deals.
"Throw" deals damage to enemies
while removing the tower status.

Please note that
lifted characters cannot take any action,
nor can they take any damage from enemy's attacks.
Your characters can gain SP and EXP
by using "throw" and "tower attack".

< Throwing a Prinny>
When you throw a Prinny,
the Prinny will deal massive damage to all enemies.
However, the thrown Prinny will explode
and become unable to fight.

title: Stats Up/Down
body:
Some skills
may increase or decrease
characters' stats.

Limitation for
stats up and down.

Stats up limitation → Up to +500%
Stats down limitation → Up to -80%

※ This includes
increase or decrease from Evilities
and skills.

title: Battle Settings
body:
< Auto (Auto-Battle)< After auto-battle is enabled, the battle will be carried out automatically.

<×1/ ×2 / ×4 (Battle Speed) >
Used to change auto-battle speed.

During a battle, you can
change power saving settings,
audio settings and other settings.
You can also abort the current battle.

When power saving mode is enabled,
battery power consumption will be reduced.
※Power saving mode applies to in-game screens, too.

When steady voice speed is enabled,
even if the battle speed is higher than x1,
the playback speed of
voice messages will remain at x1.

When "skip viewed skill effects" is enabled,
skill effects that you have seen will be skipped,
only ones that you have not seen will be played.

title: Basics
body:
You can get new characters by summoning with "Nether Quartz" or "Tickets".
Please check the summon details for the list of characters available and their drop rates.

title: Basics
body:
After becoming friends with other players,
you may send a sardine (AP)
to your friends once each day.
In addition, when you select companions,
your friends' characters will be displayed first.
To become friends with another player,
you will need to send a friend request and wait for their approval.
When you select a friend's character as your companion,
your friend will receive a sum of HL.
※This does not work for battles using DG Skip Coupons.

title: Friend Application
body:
You can search for other players and send them friend requests
or send requests in the Battle results companions function.

< When the target player accepts all friend requests,>
your friend request will be automatically approved.

< Otherwise, the player will need to review your friend request, via >
"Friends> New" and accept or decline your request.

You can change your own friend request
settings via "Menu> Settings".

title: Sending Sardines
body:
You can send a
sardine to your friends once each day.
Sardines are
reset daily at 00:00.

Players who receive sardines from friends
will have their AP slightly restored.

Sardines sent to friends one day earlier,
can still be accepted by recipients the next day.
※Sardines sent before the previous day will be put into the gift box.
※ Claiming sardines from the gift box
does not contribute to mission progress.

title: Party
body:
You can set up the members of your party. 

If a party member's Evilities and Sub Evilities can be applied to the whole party, their effects will be shown on all party members. 

You can slide left and right to switch between parties. 
You can rename a party by tapping the icon on the right of the party's name.

title: Character List
body:
This screen displays all of your owned characters.

Tap a character to check their details.

Tap the "Dismiss" button at the top left
to enter the
character dismissal (selling) screen.

title: Equipment List
body:
A list to show all the equipment you own. 

You can tap on a piece of equipment to check details. 
You can Transfer Innocents via Details.

title: Innocent List
body:
A list to show all the Innocents you own. 

Unsubdued Innocents will appear as a question mark. 

Innocents that have been transferred to other equipment after being subdued will be locked and require HL to unlock. 

You can demote Innocents and get HL by using "Innocent Demotion" in the warehouse.

title: Basics
body:
Battle (Dimension Gate) is the entrance to all battles.
 
 You can access gameplay such as the Main Story and Netherworld History by tapping Battle (Dimension Gate).

title: Basics
body:
DISGAEA RPG's original story mode. 

There are two parts to it: 
Story and Quests. 
It costs AP to battle in Quests.

title: Difficulties
body:
Main Story mode has
three difficulty levels:
Easy, Normal, and Hard.

Complete EP 1 in Easy mode to unlock EP 1 in Normal mode.
Complete EP 7 in Easy mode to unlock EP 1 in Hard mode.
Now you know how to unlock EP 1 in each difficulty level.

title: About Carnage Mode
body:
By fulfilling certain requirements,
you may unlock the extremely difficult
"Carnage Mode"
in the Main Story.
The same as Ordinary Mode,
Carnage mode also has three difficulty levels:
Easy, Normal, and Hard.

title: Companions
body:
One Companion unit can be selected before every battle.

The Companion can be swapped in at any time during your turn. 

The Evility and Sub Evilities of the Companion are in full effect from the start of battle.

The Companions and their stats available are limited to certain characters and thresholds in certain Quests.

title: Quest Missions
body:
Each Quest has 3 special Missions. 

You'll get a one-time reward by completing all the missions.

title: Basics
body:
Netherworld History
allows you to relive
the classic stories of the previous
Disgaea installments.

There are two modes in Netherworld History mode:
story and challenge.
Challenging stages
costs AP.

title: Basics
body:
There are 4 gates in Dark Gates: 
The Gate of EXP, The Gate of HL, The Gate of Gems (Humanoid) and 
The Gate of Gems (Monster).

You can challenge these gates a certain number of times each day. 
Challenge attempts are restored at the daily reset time.

You can challenge them beyond that limit with Gate Key.

What's more, you can skip battles with DG Skip Coupons after clearing all Quest Missions.

title: Basics
body:
Item World
is a series of stages
that exists in each item.

Whenever you complete a stage in the Item World,
the item will be enhanced.

In addition,
you may subdue Innocents you encounter
and further enhance the item.

< Auto-Battle>
During Item World battles,
tap the button at the top left corner
to automatically enter the next floor
in the battle result screen.

title: Item World Levels
body:
The number of stages in the Item World
varies with the rarity of the item.

<COMMON>
30 Levels

<RARE>
60 Levels

<LEGENDARY>
100 Levels

title: Subduing Innocents
body:
When you challenge stages in the Item World,
you may encounter Innocents who live in the equipment.

When you encounter an Innocent,
you may choose from the following actions.
< Bribe>
< Subdue>

< Bribe>
Players can Bribe Innocents and
increase intimacy.
When intimacy is higher,
the "subdue" function will have
a higher success rate.

< Subdue>
Subdue an Innocent
When your intimacy is higher, the "subdue" function will be more likely to succeed.

Once the Innocent is subdued,
your equipment will
gain the Innocent's effect.
In addition, you can
make your Innocents
migrate to other equipment.
If you fail to subdue the Innocent, it may take the following actions. nEscape or Intimacy Up
An escaped Innocent
will vanish forever.
If the Innocent's intimacy increases,
you can try to
"subdue" the Innocent once more.

title: Bosses
body:
When you reach a certain level in the Item World,
the following bosses will appear.

< Item General>
Appears every 10 levels.
Defeat the Item General to upgrade the equipment by 5 or 6 levels.
< Item King>
Appears every 30 levels.
Defeat the Item King to upgrade the equipment by 11 levels.
< Item God>
Appears every 100 levels.
Defeat the Item God to upgrade the equipment by 21 levels.
※ When you meet multiple boss appearance requirements, only the higher level boss will appear.

In addition, whenever you defeat a boss,
you may receive a piece of equipment that is
1 rank higher than the current equipment.

title: Basics
body:
Available after clearing the Main Story EP 7 EASY.

Your aim is to advance in the Overlord's Tower to the top level.

More levels are added periodically. 
※ All rewards are one-off rewards, only issued when clearing a level for the first time. 

No Companions are allowed in the Overlord's Tower.

title: Basics
body:
You may challenge the Ultimate Demon Ritual
after completing the main story EP 7 in Hard mode.

In Ultimate Demon Ritual,
you may unlock your characters' potential
abilities by meeting certain requirements.

Companions are not allowed in
Ultimate Demon Ritual battles.

title: About Potential Abilities
body:
Each character has 10 tiers of potential abilities.
When their potential abilities are unlocked,
they may gain the following effects.

Increase SPD,
Increase SP when a battle starts,
Unique skills deal more damage,
Unique skills have improved effects,
Unique skills cost less SP,
Increase base stats,
Increase HP,
Increase ATK,
Increase INT,
Increase DEF,
Increase RES

title: About Potential Type Scrolls
body:
Potential Type Scrolls are items
essential to unlocking potential abilities in Ultimate Demon Ritual.

Characters of different potential types
require different scrolls.
Scrolls can be used
to upgrade potential types.
You can get scrolls via the "Mission" tag at the left of the stronghold screen.

title: Basics
body:
The Biggest Badass ○○ Contest
will become available after you
clear EP 10 of the Main Story in Easy mode.

In the Biggest Badass ○○ Content,
you can challenge stages exclusive to certain characters.

Only the challengers may participate in the Biggest Badass ○○ Contest.
Clear stages to get rewards.
In addition, you can also compete
against other players on the character leaderboards.

title: About Helpers
body:
You can set helpers for challengers
in the Biggest Badass ○○ Contest.

Your helpers
can provide Evilities effects for challengers
and raise their base stats.

※You cannot assign characters of the same name as helpers.
※ The max number of helpers is determined
by the challenger's Nether Enhancement level.

title: About Character Badges
body:
Whenever a challenger reaches the 500F in the Biggest Badass ○○ Contest,
you will receive that character's badge.
If you clear more stages after the 500F,
the appearance of the badge will change.

title: About Special Rules
body:
There are a number of
special rules in the Biggest Badass ○○ Contest.
For further details, please refer to
"Rules" in the Biggest Badass ○○ Contest.

※Special rules may vary
as new update patches are released.

title: About Daily Missions
body:
You can get
daily rewards by completing
daily missions.

Daily missions are reset daily at 00:00.
Unclaimed rewards will also be
reset.

title: About Weekly Missions
body:
You can get
weekly rewards by completing
weekly missions.

Weekly missions are reset daily at 00:00 every Monday.
Unclaimed rewards will also be
reset.

title: About Repeatable Missions
body:
You can get
rewards by completing
repeatable missions.

After you claim the rewards, mission progress will be reset
and you will be able to re-challenge the mission as many times as you please.

title: Milestones
body:
You can gain rewards
by meeting the requirements
of cumulative missions.

Cumulative missions are categorized into
< Bronze,>< Silver>< and Gold>
3 based on their difficulty.
Missions of each category are calculated independently.

title: About Cultivation Missions
body:
You can receive rewards
by cultivating your characters
and fulfilling character
cultivation requirements.

In addition, you can receive extra rewards
by completing all of the missions.

title: Item World
body:
You can receive rewards
by fulfilling Innocent-related
requirements in the
Item World.

In addition, you can receive extra rewards
by completing all of the missions.

title: Basics
body:
You can purchase various Items, Equipment and Nether Quartz in the Shop (RQ Shop).

You can also sell equipment, expand slots for characters and equipment, and participate in lotteries here.

title: Customer Rank
body:
Better equipment becomes available with higher Customer Ranks.

You can increase your Customer Rank by passing bills in the Dark Assembly. 

Bills that increase your Customer Rank will be unlocked at certain points in the Main Story.

title: Purchasing Nether Quartz
body: You can purchase Nether Quartz and Special Offer Packs.

title: Purchasing Items
body:
You can purchase AP Potions and "Bribe" Items 
with Nether Quartz and HL.

title: About the Netherworld Market
body:
In the Netherworld Market,
you can exchange Prinny Coins
for various items.

< What Are Prinny Coins? >
You can obtain Prinny Coins by dismissing
3★ or better characters.

The amount of Prinny Coins gained
is determined by the character's original ★.
Therefore, even if you have awakened a character in Mao's training room,
you will not get more coins by dismissing them.

Dismissing a 3★ character → Prinny Coin ×200
Dismissing a 4★ character → Prinny Coin ×2000

※ You can dismiss characters via
Squad → Character List → Dismiss.

※ Prinnies are regarded as 1★ character.
You can get Prinnies by purchasing gifts and packs.
Even if you dismiss a 3★ or better Prinny,
you will not get Prinny Coins.
※ For 3★ characters who were counted as
4★ characters in the featured summons,
they are calculated based on their actual ★ when dismissed.
※ Please check carefully how many Prinny Coins
you can receive before dismissing your characters.

title: About Exchanging Materials
body:
You can exchange Character Crystals
for Prism Hides in the Exchange.
n
The amount of crystals required to
exchange for Prism Hides varies by character.
Please check how many crystals
are required before confirming the exchange.

title: Purchasing Equipment
body:
You can purchase equipment based on your Customer Rank. 

You can refresh the current merchandise list for free 5 times a day. 
Extra refreshes cost Nether Quartz.
Free refreshes are restored at the daily reset time. 

In addition, you can refresh the list with a lower Customer Rank than your current one. 

The shop will automatically refresh based on your current Customer Rank at daily reset time every day.

title: Selling Equipment
body:
You can sell any equipment you own. 

Equipped equipment will not be shown in the list of sellable items. 
You should note that all Innocents in the equipment will disappear when you sell it.

title: Expanding Slots
body:
You can use Nether Quartz
to expand your character and equipment slots.

Expand your slots via
Purchase Item → Purchase Nether Quartz, and scroll to the bottom.

title: Lottery
body:
After you purchase a certain amount of items and equipment,
you will get a Lucky Ball Lottery Ticket (max. 1 per day).

You can use these tickets
to draw lotteries.

These will gift
random rewards.
Please kindly note that the required
number of purchases will be reset at 00:00 daily.

title: Basics
body:
You can claim rewards based on your injuries, as well as use the Doping Roulette to restore some 
AP.

title: Rewards
body:
You will also receive rewards when you reach certain amounts of < Total Damage Taken>
,< Members Defeated>
and< Party Wipes.

※< Damage taken> in the battles
in which you are defeated
is not counted.

title: Doping Roulette
body:
It's a Roulette that restores AP. 

You have to wait for a while between uses.

title: Basics
body: You can pass bills in the Dark Assembly in order to improve your game experience, including increasing your Customer Rank at the RQ Shop.

title: Assembly Point
body:
These are the Pts needed to propose bills in the Dark Assembly. 
Costs vary depending on the bills proposed. 

Pts reset to 100 at 00:00 each day. 
You can also manually reset them to 100 using Nether Quartz.

title: The Probability of Bill
body:
The Likeliness of Passing depends on the bill itself. 
The Likeliness for certain bills increases as the player levels up. 

It's essential to "Bribe" the senators to get their affinity for a higher chance to pass your bill.

title: Bribing
body:
You can "Bribe" the senators to earn their affinity. 

With a higher affinity, there's a better chance for the senator to support your bill, thus increasing the likeliness of your bill getting passed.

If you need to raise your affinity with multiple senators, you'll need to bribe them all.

title: Senators
body:
In the Dark Assembly, 8 Senators are required to vote on each bill. 

Senators have their ★ numbers and levels as well. 
Stronger Senators have a bigger say, thus could influence the result more than others.

title: Basics
body: You can enhance your characters in Mao's Lab via Reincarnation, Awakening, N.E., Mana Allocation, etc.

title: Basics
body:
Nether Enhancement allows
your characters to learn new
skills and Sub Evilities,
increasing their stats
and enhancing their overall prowess.

Nether Enhancement
costs a character
of the same name.
Nether Enhancement also costs HL.

When you choose a Nether-enhanced character
as enhancement material,
the material's enhancement count
will be added to the target character's
enhancement count.
In this case, the HL cost for
Nether Enhancement will also increase.
n
However,
Nether Enhancement is not possible
if the total Nether Enhancement count is higher than 10.

For example,
when you use a character who has been
Nether enhanced once as material
to enhance an unenhanced character,
the total enhancement times will become 2.
The HL cost will
increase accordingly.

In addition, N.E. Prinnies
can be used as a
universal material.
If you have collected enough Prism Hides
or Character Crystals,
you can also use them as material
in the same way as N.E. Prinnies.
※Use of Character Crystals
will be prioritized over Prism Hides.

title: N.E. Items
body:
There can be up to 10 N.E.s for a character. 

You unlock 1 new item from top to bottom 
each time you N.E.

title: Basics
body:
You can improve a character by getting more ★ in character Awakening. 

You can consume 5 characters 
of the same ★ as material to Awaken the one you want to improve. 
It costs HL to Awaken characters. 

You can awaken 1★ and 2★ characters in bulk by using "Awaken All". 
In this case, the character you are training cannot be selected as material. 
In addition, weapons and armor equipped by the material character will be unequipped.

title: Basics
body:
In a Reincarnation, choose the character which you'd like to upgrade to the highest level. 
Reincarnation will reset the character to level "1" and 

- cap up the character's Max Level
- increase the character's basic stats
- enable the character to level up faster 
- get mana from reincarnation With these, you can further enhance the character.
It also costs HL.

title: Reincarnation Materials
body:
The necessary materials for the Reincarnation differ according to the target (Humanoid/Monster), and the number of reincarnation times. 

Materials are mainly obtained from the Dark Gates.

title: Basics
body:
Mana Allocation refers to using the Mana you get from Reincarnation on "Ability Enhancement" and "WM Level Cap Up" etc to further improve the character. 

You can also increase the Mana for a character by using "Mana Potion".

title: Ability Cheat
body:
You can spend Mana to
increase your characters' enhancement level.
Each stat can be enhanced up to 20 times.

Each enhancement increases the target stats by 1%.

title: Increasing Max Weapon Mastery Lv
body: You can use Mana to increase Max Weapon Mastery Lv.

title: Resetting Mana Allocation
body:
You can reset the Mana you allocated on ability enhancement. 

After resetting, previously enhanced stats will be returned to their unimproved state. 

However, Mana invested on Max Weapon Mastery Lv cannot be reset. 

You can reset Mana Allocation for free a certain number of times, after that it will cost Nether Quartz to do so again.

title: Basics
body:
You can replay all Stories you've gone through, including Main Story and Events in the Memory Shop. 

You can even watch Character EPs once certain conditions have been met.

title: Character Episodes
body:
When certain characters reach certain levels, you can watch their unique stories. 

You will get rewards after watching these stories.

title: Basics
body:
You can check various information
in the Data Shop.

< Character Illustration>
Here you can check information
of characters that you own.

< Equipment Illustration>
Here you can check information
of equipment that you own.

< Game Records>
Here you can check your gameplay duration,
max damage dealt
and other records as well as your rankings.

title: Basics
body:
As your characters become stronger in the Potential Type Shop,
characters of each type will gain bonus
effects based on their potential type.

title: About Type Group Levels
body:
When each potential type's
feature reaches a certain level,
the type group will level up. n
After the level up,
the icon for the potential level will become more elaborate,
this makes it clearer to see
how much you have cultivated your characters.

title: About Feature Levels
body:
Each potential type contains 3 features.
Different features
grant different stat bonuses.
You can gain Feature EXP
by fulfilling certain requirements.
Once you have accumulated enough EXP,
the feature will level up.

Features of a higher level
provide more potent bonus effects.

For< Strength>
characters, you will gain EXP when
their level cap is raised.
Strength level increases your characters' base stats.
Forn
< Demeanor>
characters, you will gain EXP when
their ★ is upgraded.
Demeanor level increases your
weapons' base stats.
Forn
< Passion>
characters, you will gain EXP when
they are Nether Enhanced.
Passion level increases the
stat bonuses from Nether Enhancement.

title: Basics
body:
In the Fishing Fleet,
you can send your characters to fish.
After some time,
you will receive EXP
as well as items for character cultivation.
The better the fishing results,
the more EXP
and better items you will receive.
Sometimes you may even
receive crystals for the assigned characters.
※Some characters' crystals
cannot be obtained from the Fishing Fleet.

There are 3 fishing areas
and the amount of EXP you can earn varies.

※Characters' Evilities, EXP boost effect from the Dark Assembly, or Innocent effects do not influence rewards and EXP earned from the Fishing Fleet.

title: About Bribery
body:
You can perform "Bribe" in the Fishing Fleet
to improve the condition of fish schools in each fishing area.

The higher the condition,
the higher the success rate.

title: About Fishing Fleet Level
body:
You will gain Fishing Fleet Points from each fishing.
Once you have earned enough points,
a bill entitled "Upgrade Fishing Fleet"
will appear in the Dark Assembly.
Pass the bill to upgrade your Fishing Fleet.

After the Fishing Fleet levels up,
the max number of crew increases as well.
Your characters will gain more EXP and have more fishing options.

title: Basics
body:
Once you have completed all of the Item World missions,
Etna's Summer Resort will be unlocked.

In the resort,
you can use exclusive materials
to raise equipment rarity,
increase POP, enhance Innocents
and breed Innocents with new effects.

You can also donate Innocents and equipment
to receive exclusive materials.
Also, you can get materials
by completing missions on the request board.

title: About Throne Levels
body:
You can upgrade the Throne
to unlock various facilities in Etna's Summer Resort.

You can donate subdued Innocents and max level equipment
to upgrade the Throne.

title: Basics
body:
You can receive character crystals
based on how well you have
cultivated your characters.

Some characters do not
grant you crystals,
but Prism Hides instead.

title: Basics
body:
You can customize the background and BGM of your stronghold.

· The BGM and Background of the stronghold 
can be changed at will. 

You can get new BGM and Backgrounds via Dark Assembly and other means. 

In order for the corresponding bill to become available, you need to reach a certain point in the main story.

title: Basics
body:
Data sharing
allows you to inherit your game progress on new devices
and play this game on multiple devices.

Tap "Menu" at the top right,
then "Data Sharing",
you will receive a data sharing code.

Download and install this game
on the target device,
and tap "Menu" at the top right,
then "Data Sharing",
entering your ID and data sharing code.
This will allow your game progress to be carried over.

Paid Nether Quartz cannot be shared across different platforms.
However, you can convert Paid Nether Quartz into Free Nether Quartz and use Free Nether Quartz on other platforms.
※Free Nether Quartz cannot be converted back.

You can share your game progress on up to 3 devices.
If you share your game progress on more devices,
a window will pop up,
asking if you would like to cancel data sharing on all devices.
Please carefully check the content in the pop-up window
before making your decision.
※Data sharing cannot be canceled on PC the platform.

title: Basics
body:
You can fix certain unexpected glitches to improve your game experience through "Clear Cache".

All you need to do is tap MENU at the top right, then tap "Clear Cache".

title: Basics
body:
With Data Repair, you can delete generated data and keep operations running smoothly.
Your saved game progress will not be deleted. 

You can do this by tapping MENU at the top right, and then tapping "Data Repair".

title: Basics
body:
You can tap MENU at the top right, then tap "Settings" to change the following settings: 
Power-saving, Volume, Notification, Friend Approval etc.

The game will consume less power when Power-saving is turned ON. 
※ The game UI will enter Power-saving mode as well.

Please note: 
if you have disabled notifications on your device, you won't receive notifications even if you enable them here in the game.

title: Basics
body:
Tap "Menu" at the top right to change your in-game settings,
including power saving mode, volume,
and friend request acceptance.

When power saving mode is enabled,
battery power consumption will be reduced.
※Power saving mode applies to in-game screens, too.
